text: Messages Concerning Egypt
The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

Concerning Egypt: Concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco, the king of Egypt, which was by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, the king of Judah.
“Prepare small shield and shield,
and approach for the battle!
Harness the horses and mount the steeds!
And take your stand with helmets!
Polish the spears!
Put on the body armor!
Why do I see them terrified?
\add They are\add* turning back
and their warriors are beaten down.
And they have fled \add to\add* a place of refuge
and they do not turn \add back\add*.
Terror \add is\add* from all around,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 46:5 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
The swift cannot flee,
and the warrior cannot escape.
They have stumbled and they have fallen,
by the bank of the Euphrates River.
Who \add is\add* this that rises like the Nile,
like the rivers whose waters surge?
Egypt rises like the Nile,
even like the rivers \add whose\add* waters surge.
And he says, “Let me rise,
let me cover \add the\add* earth,
let me destroy cities,
and the inhabitants in them.”
Go up, O horses,
and drive madly, O chariots,\f + \fr 46:9 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f*
and let the warriors go forth;
Cush and Put, who wield \add the\add* small shield,
and Lud, who wield \add and\add* bend \add the\add* bow.
For that day \add is\add* to the Lord Yahweh of hosts
a day of retribution,
to take revenge on his foes.
And \add the\add* sword will devour and be satisfied,
and it will drink its fill of their blood,
for a sacrifice \add is\add* for the Lord Yahweh of hosts
in the land of \add the\add* north by the Euphrates River.
Go up \add to\add* Gilead and take balm,
O virgin of the daughter of Egypt.
⸤In vain⸥\f + \fr 46:11 \ft Literally “To the vanity” \f* you make use of many medicines;
there is no healing for you.
\add The\add* nations have heard your shame,
and your cry of lament fills the earth.
For warrior has stumbled against warrior,
together they have fallen, the two of them.
The word that Yahweh spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon to attack the land of Egypt:
“Declare in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol,
and proclaim in Memphis and in Tahpanhes,
say, ‘Take your stand and be prepared,
for \add the\add* sword will devour \add those\add* all around you.’
Why are your bulls defeated?
He did not stand because Yahweh thrust him down.
He multiplied \add the\add* ones\f + \fr 46:16 \ft Hebrew “one” \f* stumbling.
Furthermore, each one fell to his neighbor,
and said, ‘Stand up, and let us return to our people
and to the land of our birth,
⸤because of⸥\f + \fr 46:16 \ft Literally “from” \f* the ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 46:16 \ft Literally “face” \f* of the sword of the oppressor.’
They will call there,
‘Pharaoh, the king of Egypt \add is but\add* a roar,
⸤he missed the opportunity⸥.’\f + \fr 46:17 \ft Literally “he has allowed to pass over the appointed time” \f*
⸤As I live⸥,”\f + \fr 46:18 \ft Literally “Life I” \f* ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 46:18 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* the king,
Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name,
“one will come like Tabor among the mountains
and like Carmel by the sea.
Pack \add your\add* baggage for exile,
O inhabitants\f + \fr 46:19 \ft Hebrew “inhabitant” \f* of the daughter of Egypt,
for Memphis will become as a horror,
and it will be destroyed, ⸤without⸥\f + \fr 46:19 \ft Literally “from there is not” \f* inhabitant.
Egypt \add is\add* a beautiful heifer,
\add but\add* a gadfly from \add the\add* north \add will\add* come against her.
Even her mercenaries in her midst \add are\add* like calves of fattening,
for they also have turned away,
they have fled together.
They stand not,
for the day of their calamity has come,
the time of their punishment.
Her sound \add is\add* like a snake \add that\add* glides away,
for they march in force.
And with axes they come to her
like those who chop trees.
They will cut down her forest,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 46:23 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“for ⸤it is impenetrable⸥.\f + \fr 46:23 \ft Literally “it cannot be searched out” \f*
Yes, they are more numerous than locusts,\f + \fr 46:23 \ft Hebrew “locust” \f*
and ⸤they are without number⸥.\f + \fr 46:23 \ft Literally “there is not to them a number” \f*
The daughter of Egypt will be ashamed,
she will be given into the hand of \add the\add* people of \add the\add* north.”
Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, said, “Look, I \add am\add* going to punish Amon of Thebes, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, and her gods, and her kings, even Pharaoh and those who trust in him.

And I will give them into the hand of the seekers of their lives,\f + \fr 46:26 \ft Hebrew “life” \f* and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and into the hand of his troops. But ⸤afterward⸥\f + \fr 46:26 \ft Literally “after thus” \f* it will \add be\add* inhabited, as \add in\add* days of old,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 46:26 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“But \add as for\add* you, my servant Jacob, you must not be afraid,
and Israel, you must not be dismayed,
for look, I \add am\add* going to save you from far,
and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
And Jacob will return,
and he will be quiet,
and he will be at ease,
and without \add one who\add* makes \add him\add* afraid.
You must not be afraid, my servant Jacob,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 46:28 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“for I \add am\add* with you.
For I will make a complete destruction in all the nations where I scattered you,
but you I will not make a complete destruction,
though I will chastise you to the measure,
and I will certainly not leave you unpunished.”
